p: Identified bacterial colonies were purified and their susceptibility patterns were determined for various antibiotics using a modified form of the Kirby Bauer method [ 22, 23]. Antibiotics tested included ampicillin, tetracycline, trimethroprim/sulfamethoxazole, gentamycin, cefuroxime, cefotaxime, amikacin, ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, ceftazidime, meropenem, piperacillin/tazobactam, amoxicillin/clavulanic acid, cefepime, colistin, erythromycin, cefoxitin, vancomycin, teicoplanin and clindamycin. These antibiotics were tested because they seem to be common on the Ghanaian market.
